t: Isaiah 19
Message to Egypt

The*p oracle concerning Egypt. Behold,*pn the Lord*s is riding on a swift cloud and is about to come to Egypt; The*ln idols of Egypt will tremble at His presence, And*ln the heart of the Egyptians will melt within them.
“So*ln I will incite Egyptians against Egyptians; And*ln they will each fight against his brother and each against his neighbor, City*ln against city and*i kingdom against kingdom.

Then*ln the spirit of the Egyptians will be demoralized within them; And*ln I will confound their strategy, So*ln that they will resort to idols and ghosts of the dead And*ln to mediums and spiritists.
Moreover,*ln I will deliver the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel master, And*ln a mighty king will rule over them,” declares the Lord God*s of hosts.
The*ln waters from the sea will dry up, And*ln the river will be parched and dry.
The*ln canals will emit a stench, The*ln streams of Egypt will thin out and dry up; The*ln reeds and rushes will rot away.
The*ln bulrushes by the Nile, by the edge of the Nile And*ln all the sown fields by the Nile Will*ln become dry, be driven away, and be no more.
And*ln the fishermen will lament, And*ln all those who cast a line into the Nile will mourn, And*ln those who spread nets on the waters will pine away.
Moreover,*ln the manufacturers of linen made from combed flax And*ln the weavers of white cloth will be utterly dejected.
And*ln the pillars of*i Egypt*i will be crushed; All*ln the hired laborers will be grieved in soul.
The*ln princes of Zoan are mere fools; The*ln advice of Pharaoh’s wisest advisers has become stupid. How*ln can you men*i say to Pharaoh, “I*ln am a son of the wise, a son of ancient kings”?
Well*ln then, where are your wise men? Please*ln let them tell you, And*ln let them understand what the Lord*s of hosts Has*ln purposed against Egypt.
The*ln princes of Zoan have acted foolishly, The*ln princes of Memphis are deluded; Those*iln who*i are*i the cornerstone of her tribes Have*ln led Egypt astray.
The*ln Lord*s has mixed within her a spirit of distortion; They*ln have led Egypt astray in all that it does, As*ln a drunken man staggers in his vomit.
There*ln will be no work for Egypt Which*ln its*i head or tail, its*i palm branch or bulrush, may do.
In*p that day the Egyptians will become like women, and they will tremble and be in dread because of the waving of the hand of the Lord*s of hosts, which He is going to wave over them.
The land of Judah will become a terror to Egypt; everyone to whom it is mentioned will be in dread of it, because of the purpose of the Lord*s of hosts which He is purposing against them.
In*p that day five cities in the land of Egypt will be speaking the language of Canaan and swearing allegiance*i to the Lord*s of hosts; one will be called the City of Destruction.
In*p that day there will be an altar to the Lord*s in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to the Lord*s near its border.

It will become a sign and a witness to the Lord*s of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to the Lord*s because of oppressors, and He will send them a Savior and a Champion, and He will deliver them.

Thus the Lord*s will make Himself known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know the Lord*s in that day. They will even worship with sacrifice and offering, and will make a vow to the Lord*s and perform it.
The Lord*s will strike Egypt, striking but healing; so they will return to the Lord,*s and He will respond to them and will heal them.
In*p that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrians will come into Egypt and the Egyptians into Assyria, and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.
In*p that day Israel will be the third party*i with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth,
whom the Lord*s of hosts has blessed, saying, “Blessed is Egypt My people, and Assyria the work of My hands, and Israel My inheritance.”
